item.title: Reading binary files in Python
item.description:
Description

How can you read binary files in Python? And how can you read very large binary files in small chunks?

item.title: Unicode character encodings
item.description:
Description

When working with text files in Python, it's considered a best practice to specify the character encoding that you're working with.
item.dc:creator: Trey Hunner

item.title: How to write to a file in Python
item.description:
Description

To write to a file in Python, you can use the built-in open function, specifying a mode of w or wt and then use the write method on the file object.
item.dc:creator: Trey Hunner

item.title: Read a file line-by-line in Python
item.description:
Description

When Python reads a file line-by-line, it doesn't store the whole file in memory all at once. Files are lazy iterables, and as we loop over a file object, we'll get lines from that file.
item.dc:creator: Trey Hunner

item.title: How to read from a text file
item.description:
Description

To work with a text file in Python, you can use the built-in open function, which gives you back a file object. Reading from and writing to text files is an important skill.
item.dc:creator: Trey Hunner
